headline: Mike Pence makes South Carolina big part of plans for 2024 presidential bid
author: David M. Drucker
sentences: Pence is headed back to the Palmetto State in April and May as part of a deliberate strategy to build support with conservative activists and Republican operatives in the state that hosts the third primary on the GOP nominating calendar — and first in the South.

Leading this effort is the plugged-in national Republican strategist Chip Saltsman as well as Josh Kimbrell, a state senator described as an “ambassador” for Pence in South Carolina, with other party insiders quietly assisting.
Former Vice President Mike Pence is dropping anchor in South Carolina as he prepares to mount a 2024 White House bid.
